sentences: This document describes the software requirements for ShopEase, an e-commerce platform that enables customers to browse products, place orders, and manage their accounts.
ShopEase is a web-based e-commerce application consisting of multiple bounded contexts including Customer Management, Order Processing, Inventory Management, and Payment Processing.
ShopEase operates as a standalone e-commerce platform with integrations to external payment gateways and shipping providers.
The Customer entity represents an individual or organization that registers on the platform to purchase products.
Each Customer has a unique identifier, email address, and profile information.
The term "Customer" must be used consistently.
Terms like "Client", "User", "Buyer", or "Shopper" should NOT be used as they create confusion in the ubiquitous language.
A Customer can have multiple Addresses stored in their account.
An Address is a value object containing street, city, postal code, and country information.
Customers can create Wishlists to save products they are interested in for future purchase.
An Order represents a Customer's request to purchase one or more products.
Each Order has a unique order number, creation date, and status.
The term "Order" must be used consistently.
Terms like "Purchase", "Transaction", "Sale", or "Acquisition" should NOT be used.
An Order contains multiple OrderItems.
Each OrderItem represents a specific product and quantity within the order.
The OrderStatus value object tracks the lifecycle of an order: Pending, Confirmed, Shipped, Delivered, or Cancelled.
OrderPlaced: Triggered when a customer submits a new order
OrderConfirmed: Triggered when payment is successfully processed
OrderShipped: Triggered when the order is dispatched
OrderDelivered: Triggered when delivery is confirmed
OrderCancelled: Triggered when an order is cancelled
A Product represents an item available for sale on the platform.
Each Product has a SKU, name, description, and price.
The term "Product" must be used consistently.
Terms like "Item", "Good", "Merchandise", or "Article" should NOT be used.
The StockLevel value object tracks the available quantity of each product.
It includes current quantity, reserved quantity, and reorder threshold.
A Category organizes products into logical groups for easier navigation.
StockDepleted: Triggered when stock falls below reorder threshold
StockReplenished: Triggered when new inventory arrives
ProductCreated: Triggered when a new product is added
ProductDiscontinued: Triggered when a product is removed from sale
A Payment represents a financial transaction for an order.
Each Payment has a unique transaction ID, amount, currency, and status.
The term "Payment" must be used consistently.
Terms like "Transaction", "Charge", "Bill", or "Invoice" should NOT be used for payment operations.
The Money value object represents monetary values with currency and amount attributes.
PaymentMethod stores the customer's payment information (credit card, PayPal, etc.).
PaymentInitiated: Triggered when payment processing begins
PaymentCompleted: Triggered when payment is successful
PaymentFailed: Triggered when payment is declined
RefundProcessed: Triggered when a refund is issued
Order Processing depends on Customer Management (to retrieve customer information)
Order Processing depends on Inventory Management (to check product availability)
Order Processing depends on Payment Processing (to process payments)
Payment Processing depends on Customer Management (to retrieve payment methods)
Direct dependencies between Inventory Management and Payment Processing are NOT allowed.
They must communicate through Order Processing.
All entity and class names must use PascalCase (e.g., Customer, OrderItem, StockLevel).
Manager (use specific service names instead)
Helper (use explicit purpose names)
Util / Utility (use domain-specific names)
Data (use explicit entity names)
Info (use specific attribute names)
Handler (use event-specific names)
Processor (use domain action names)
Customer - An individual or organization that purchases products through the platform
Order - A customer's request to purchase products
Product - An item available for sale
Payment - A financial transaction for an order
Address - A location where orders can be delivered
OrderItem - A line item in an order representing a product and quantity
StockLevel - The available quantity of a product
Money - A monetary value with currency
